name: serve
description: Builds and serves your app, rebuilding on file changes.

options.name: project
options.description: The name of the project to build. Can be an application or a library.

options.name: configuration
options.description:
One or more named builder configurations as a comma-separated list as specified in the "configurations" section of angular.json.
The builder uses the named configurations to run the given target.
For more information, see https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#alternate-build-configurations.
Setting this explicitly overrides the "--prod" flag.

options.name: prod
options.description:
Shorthand for "--configuration=production".
Set the build configuration to the production target.
By default, the production target is set up in the workspace configuration such that all builds make use of bundling, limited tree-shaking, and also limited dead code elimination.

options.name: help
options.description: Shows a help message for this command in the console.

options.name: browser-target
options.description: A browser builder target to serve in the format of `project:target[:configuration]`. You can also pass in more than one configuration name as a comma-separated list. Example: `project:target:production,staging`.

options.name: port
options.description: Port to listen on.

options.name: host
options.description: Host to listen on.

options.name: proxy-config
options.description: Proxy configuration file.

options.name: ssl
options.description: Serve using HTTPS.

options.name: ssl-key
options.description: SSL key to use for serving HTTPS.

options.name: ssl-cert
options.description: SSL certificate to use for serving HTTPS.

options.name: open
options.description: Opens the url in default browser.

options.name: verbose
options.description: Adds more details to output logging.

options.name: live-reload
options.description: Whether to reload the page on change, using live-reload.

options.name: public-host
options.description: The URL that the browser client (or live-reload client, if enabled) should use to connect to the development server. Use for a complex dev server setup, such as one with reverse proxies.

options.name: allowed-hosts
options.description: List of hosts that are allowed to access the dev server.

options.name: serve-path
options.description: The pathname where the app will be served.

options.name: disable-host-check
options.description: Don't verify connected clients are part of allowed hosts.

options.name: hmr
options.description: Enable hot module replacement.

options.name: watch
options.description: Rebuild on change.

options.name: hmr-warning
options.description: Show a warning when the --hmr option is enabled.

options.name: serve-path-default-warning
options.description: Show a warning when deploy-url/base-href use unsupported serve path values.

options.name: optimization
options.description: Enables optimization of the build output. Including minification of scripts and styles, tree-shaking, dead-code elimination, tree-shaking and fonts inlining. For more information, see https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#optimization-configuration.
options.deprecated: Use the "optimization" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: aot
options.description: Build using Ahead of Time compilation.
options.deprecated: Use the "aot" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: source-map
options.description: Output source maps for scripts and styles. For more information, see https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#source-map-configuration.
options.deprecated: Use the "sourceMap" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: vendor-chunk
options.description: Generate a seperate bundle containing only vendor libraries. This option should only used for development.
options.deprecated: Use the "vendorChunk" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: common-chunk
options.description: Generate a seperate bundle containing code used across multiple bundles.
options.deprecated: Use the "commonChunk" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: base-href
options.description: Base url for the application being built.
options.deprecated: Use the "baseHref" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: deploy-url
options.description: URL where files will be deployed.
options.deprecated: Use the "deployUrl" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: progress
options.description: Log progress to the console while building.
options.deprecated: Use the "progress" option in the browser builder instead.

options.name: poll
options.description: Enable and define the file watching poll time period in milliseconds.
